title: Point Cook man in coma, driver wanted after road rage brawl
text:
Road rage is on the rise in Australia. A GIO survey has found 88 per cent of drivers claim to have been a victim of it. Tailgating, Unnecessary braking and failure to indicate are among the behaviours that enrage drivers the most.

The devastated brother of a man bashed in a road rage incident has pleaded with the driver to turn himself into police.

Troy Vernon’s brother, 33, is in a critical but stable condition in an induced coma after suffering serious injuries during a brawl at Point Cook, 22km southwest of Melbourne, on Thursday night.

“I’ve been told he has head injuries,” Mr Vernon told reporters.

“Just come forward and explain what’s happened. I want to find out what’s happened and make sure the right people are charged and brought to justice.”

Mr Vernon said the young father-of-two was in a coma and things were “not good”.

Police say the two men were involved in a collision on Saltwater Promenade about 8.15pm.

After the cars collided, the drivers got out and “began arguing which soon escalated to a physical fight”.

The Point Cook man was taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries and the other driver fled.

Police say he was last seen driving a grey-coloured Ford Ranger XLT ute north along Carrick Street.

“Police urge panel beaters and members of the public to keep an eye out for the Ford Ranger which is likely to have damage to the rear and passenger side of the vehicle,” Victoria Police said in a statement.

“Investigators are appealing to any witnesses or anyone who may have been driving in the area at the time with dashcam footage to come forward.

Anyone with information is urged to contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or submit a confidential report online at www.crimestoppersvic.com.au
description: The devastated brother of a man bashed in a road rage incident has pleaded with the driver to turn himself into police.
